title: Fragments, 19th century
medium:
Medium: silk
Technique: plain weave with discontinuous supplementary wefts (brocading)
provenance: ex. coll. Antonio Vivés y Escudero
description: Length of bright purple silk taffeta, brocaded with detached motifs in black and white on floral ground. Dyed with fuschine, the first stable synthetic dye.

tombstone.epitaph:
Fragments, 19th century.
19th century. Medium: silk
Technique: plain weave with discontinuous supplementary wefts (brocading). Gift of John Pierpont Morgan. 1902-1-803-a/e.
